Welcome to gateway’s documentation!¶

class gateway.webservice.WebInterface(**kwargs)¶

This class defines the web interface served by cherrypy.

add_virtual_input()¶

Adds a new virtual input module.

Returns:dict with ‘status’.
Return type:dict
add_virtual_output()¶

Adds a new virtual output module.

Returns:dict with ‘status’.
Return type:dict
create_user(username, password)¶

Create a new user using a username and a password. Only possible in authorized mode.

Parameters:
  • username (str) – Name of the user.
  • password (str) – Password of the user.
do_basic_action(action_type, action_number)¶

Execute a basic action.

Parameters:
  • action_type (int) – The type of the action as defined by the master api.
  • action_number (int) – The number provided to the basic action, its meaning depends on the action_type.
do_group_action(group_action_id)¶

Execute a group action. :param group_action_id: The id of the group action

do_raw_energy_command(address, mode, command, data)¶

Perform a raw energy module command, for debugging purposes.

Parameters:
  • address (int) – The address of the energy module
  • mode (str) – 1 char: S or G
  • command (str) – 3 char power command
  • data (str) – comma seperated list of Bytes
Returns:

dict with ‘data’: comma separated list of Bytes
Return type:

dict
do_shutter_down(id, position=None)¶

Make a shutter go down. The shutter stops automatically when the down or specified position is reached :param id: The id of the shutter. :param position: The desired end position

do_shutter_goto(id, position)¶

Make a shutter go up or down to the specified position. :param id: The id of the shutter. :param position: The desired end position

do_shutter_group_down(id)¶

Make a shutter group go down. The shutters stop automatically when the down position is reached (after the predefined number of seconds). :param id: The id of the shutter group.

do_shutter_group_stop(id)¶

Make a shutter group stop. :param id: The id of the shutter group.

do_shutter_group_up(id)¶

Make a shutter group go up. The shutters stop automatically when the up position is reached (after the predefined number of seconds). :param id: The id of the shutter group.

do_shutter_stop(id)¶

Make a shutter stop. :param id: The id of the shutter.

do_shutter_up(id, position=None)¶

Make a shutter go up. The shutter stops automatically when the up or specified position is reached :param id: The id of the shutter. :param position: The desired end position

do_url_action(url, method='GET', headers=None, data=None, auth=None, timeout=10)¶

Execute an url action.

Parameters:
  • url (str) – The url to fetch.
  • method (str | None) – (optional) The http method (defaults to GET).
  • headers (str | None) – (optional) The http headers to send (format: json encoded dict)
  • data (str | None) – (optional) Bytes to send in the body of the request.
  • auth (str | None) – (optional) Json encoded tuple (username, password).
  • timeout (int | None) – (optional) Timeout in seconds for the http request (default = 10 sec).
Returns:

‘headers’: response headers, ‘data’: response body.
Return type:

dict
flash_leds(type, id)¶

Flash the leds on the module for an output/input/sensor.

Parameters:
  • type (int) – The module type: output/dimmer (0), input (1), sensor/temperatur (2).
  • id (int) – The id of the output/input/sensor.
Returns:

‘status’: ‘OK’.
Return type:

dict
get_airco_status()¶

Get the mode of the airco attached to a all thermostats.

Returns:dict with ASB0-ASB31.
Return type:dict
get_can_led_configuration(id, fields=None)¶

Get a specific can_led_configuration defined by its id.

Parameters:
  • id (int) – The id of the can_led_configuration
  • fields (list) – The field of the can_led_configuration to get. (None gets all fields)
Returns:

‘config’: can_led_configuration dict: contains ‘id’ (Id), ‘can_led_1_function’ (Enum), ‘can_led_1_id’ (Byte), ‘can_led_2_function’ (Enum), ‘can_led_2_id’ (Byte), ‘can_led_3_function’ (Enum), ‘can_led_3_id’ (Byte), ‘can_led_4_function’ (Enum), ‘can_led_4_id’ (Byte), ‘room’ (Byte)
Return type:

dict
get_can_led_configurations(fields=None)¶

Get all can_led_configurations.

Parameters:fields (list) – The field of the can_led_configuration to get. (None gets all fields)
Returns:‘config’: list of can_led_configuration dict: contains ‘id’ (Id), ‘can_led_1_function’ (Enum), ‘can_led_1_id’ (Byte), ‘can_led_2_function’ (Enum), ‘can_led_2_id’ (Byte), ‘can_led_3_function’ (Enum), ‘can_led_3_id’ (Byte), ‘can_led_4_function’ (Enum), ‘can_led_4_id’ (Byte), ‘room’ (Byte)
Return type:dict
get_cooling_configuration(id, fields=None)¶

Get a specific cooling_configuration defined by its id. :param id: The id of the cooling_configuration :param fields: The field of the cooling_configuration to get, None if all

get_cooling_configurations(fields=None)¶

Get all cooling_configurations. :param fields: The field of the cooling_configuration to get, None if all

get_cooling_pump_group_configuration(id, fields=None)¶

Get a specific cooling_pump_group_configuration defined by its id.

Parameters:
  • id (int) – The id of the cooling_pump_group_configuration
  • fields (list) – The field of the cooling_pump_group_configuration to get. (None gets all fields)
Returns:

‘config’: cooling_pump_group_configuration dict: contains ‘id’ (Id), ‘outputs’ (CSV[32]), ‘room’ (Byte)
Return type:

dict
get_cooling_pump_group_configurations(fields=None)¶

Get all cooling_pump_group_configurations.

Parameters:fields (list) – The field of the cooling_pump_group_configuration to get. (None gets all fields)
Returns:‘config’: list of cooling_pump_group_configuration dict: contains ‘id’ (Id), ‘outputs’ (CSV[32]), ‘room’ (Byte)
Return type:dict
get_dimmer_configuration(fields=None)¶

Get the dimmer_configuration.

Parameters:fields (list) – The field of the dimmer_configuration to get. (None gets all fields)
Returns:‘config’: dimmer_configuration dict: contains ‘dim_memory’ (Byte), ‘dim_step’ (Byte), ‘dim_wait_cycle’ (Byte), ‘min_dim_level’ (Byte)
Return type:dict
get_energy_frequency(module_id, input_id=None)¶

Gets the frequency components for a given module and optional input (no input means all)

Parameters:
  • module_id (int) – The id of the power module
  • input_id (int | None) – The id of the input on the given power module
Returns:

A dict with the input_id(s) as key, and as value another dict with for voltage and current the 20 frequency components
Return type:

dict
get_energy_time(module_id, input_id=None)¶

Gets 1 period of given module and optional input (no input means all).

Parameters:
  • module_id (int) – The id of the power module.
  • input_id (int or None) – The id of the input on the given power module
Returns:

A dict with the input_id(s) as key, and as value another dict with (up to 80) voltage and current samples.
Return type:

dict
get_errors()¶

Get the number of seconds since the last successul communication with the master and power modules (master_last_success, power_last_success) and the error list per module (input and output modules). The modules are identified by O1, O2, I1, I2, …

Returns:‘errors’: list of tuples (module, nr_errors), ‘master_last_success’: UNIX timestamp of the last succesful master communication and ‘power_last_success’: UNIX timestamp of the last successful power communication.
Return type:dict
get_features()¶

Returns all available features this Gateway supports. This allows to make flexible clients

get_full_backup()¶

Get a backup (tar) of the master eeprom and the sqlite databases.

Returns:Tar containing 4 files: master.eep, config.db, scheduled.db, power.db and eeprom_extensions.db as a string of bytes.
Return type:dict
get_global_rtd10_configuration(fields=None)¶

Get the global_rtd10_configuration.

Parameters:fields (list) – The field of the global_rtd10_configuration to get. (None gets all fields)
Returns:‘config’: global_rtd10_configuration dict: contains ‘output_value_cooling_16’ (Byte), ‘output_value_cooling_16_5’ (Byte), ‘output_value_cooling_17’ (Byte), ‘output_value_cooling_17_5’ (Byte), ‘output_value_cooling_18’ (Byte), ‘output_value_cooling_18_5’ (Byte), ‘output_value_cooling_19’ (Byte), ‘output_value_cooling_19_5’ (Byte), ‘output_value_cooling_20’ (Byte), ‘output_value_cooling_20_5’ (Byte), ‘output_value_cooling_21’ (Byte), ‘output_value_cooling_21_5’ (Byte), ‘output_value_cooling_22’ (Byte), ‘output_value_cooling_22_5’ (Byte), ‘output_value_cooling_23’ (Byte), ‘output_value_cooling_23_5’ (Byte), ‘output_value_cooling_24’ (Byte), ‘output_value_heating_16’ (Byte), ‘output_value_heating_16_5’ (Byte), ‘output_value_heating_17’ (Byte), ‘output_value_heating_17_5’ (Byte), ‘output_value_heating_18’ (Byte), ‘output_value_heating_18_5’ (Byte), ‘output_value_heating_19’ (Byte), ‘output_value_heating_19_5’ (Byte), ‘output_value_heating_20’ (Byte), ‘output_value_heating_20_5’ (Byte), ‘output_value_heating_21’ (Byte), ‘output_value_heating_21_5’ (Byte), ‘output_value_heating_22’ (Byte), ‘output_value_heating_22_5’ (Byte), ‘output_value_heating_23’ (Byte), ‘output_value_heating_23_5’ (Byte), ‘output_value_heating_24’ (Byte)
Return type:dict
get_global_thermostat_configuration(fields=None)¶

Get the global_thermostat_configuration.

Parameters:fields (list) – The field of the global_thermostat_configuration to get. (None gets all fields)
Returns:‘config’: global_thermostat_configuration dict: contains ‘outside_sensor’ (Byte), ‘pump_delay’ (Byte), ‘switch_to_cooling_output_0’ (Byte), ‘switch_to_cooling_output_1’ (Byte), ‘switch_to_cooling_output_2’ (Byte), ‘switch_to_cooling_output_3’ (Byte), ‘switch_to_cooling_value_0’ (Byte), ‘switch_to_cooling_value_1’ (Byte), ‘switch_to_cooling_value_2’ (Byte), ‘switch_to_cooling_value_3’ (Byte), ‘switch_to_heating_output_0’ (Byte), ‘switch_to_heating_output_1’ (Byte), ‘switch_to_heating_output_2’ (Byte), ‘switch_to_heating_output_3’ (Byte), ‘switch_to_heating_value_0’ (Byte), ‘switch_to_heating_value_1’ (Byte), ‘switch_to_heating_value_2’ (Byte), ‘switch_to_heating_value_3’ (Byte), ‘threshold_temp’ (Temp)
Return type:str

get_input_status()¶

Get the status of the inputs.

Returns:‘status’: list of dictionaries with the following keys: id, status.
get_last_inputs()¶

Get the 5 last pressed inputs during the last 5 minutes.

Returns:‘inputs’: list of tuples (input, output).
Return type:dict
get_master_backup()¶

Get a backup of the eeprom of the master.

Returns:This function does not return a dict, unlike all other API functions: it returns a string of bytes (size = 64kb).
Return type:bytearray
get_module_log()¶

Get the log messages from the module discovery mode. This returns the current log messages and clear the log messages.

get_modules()¶

Get a list of all modules attached and registered with the master.

Returns:Dict with:
  • ‘outputs’ (list of module types: O,R,D),
  • ‘inputs’ (list of input module types: I,T,L,C)
  • ‘shutters’ (List of modules types: S).
Return type:dict
get_modules_information(address=None, fields=None)¶

Gets an overview of all modules and information :param address: Optional address filter :param fields: The field of the module information to get, None if all

get_output_configuration(id, fields=None)¶

Get a specific output_configuration defined by its id. :param id: The id of the output_configuration :param fields: The fields of the output_configuration to get, None if all

get_output_configurations(fields=None)¶

Get all output_configurations. :param fields: The field of the output_configuration to get, None if all

get_output_status()¶

Get the status of the outputs.

Returns:‘status’: list of dictionaries with the following keys: id, status, dimmer and ctimer.
get_plugin_logs()¶

Get the logs for all plugins.

Returns:‘logs’: dict with the names of the plugins as keys and the logs (String) as value.
Return type:dict
get_plugins()¶

Get the installed plugins.

Returns:‘plugins’: dict with name, version and interfaces where name and version are strings and interfaces is a list of tuples (interface, version) which are both strings.
Return type:dict
get_power_modules()¶

Get information on the power modules. The times format is a comma seperated list of HH:MM formatted times times (index 0 = start Monday, index 1 = stop Monday, index 2 = start Tuesday, …).

Returns:‘modules’: list of dictionaries with the following keys: ‘id’, ‘name’, ‘address’, ‘input0’, ‘input1’, ‘input2’, ‘input3’, ‘input4’, ‘input5’, ‘input6’, ‘input7’, ‘sensor0’, ‘sensor1’, ‘sensor2’, ‘sensor3’, ‘sensor4’, ‘sensor5’, ‘sensor6’, ‘sensor7’, ‘times0’, ‘times1’, ‘times2’, ‘times3’, ‘times4’, ‘times5’, ‘times6’, ‘times7’.
Return type:dict

Get the pulse counter values.

get_status()¶

Get the status of the master.

Returns:‘time’: hour and minutes (HH:MM), ‘date’: day, month, year (DD:MM:YYYY), ‘mode’: Integer, ‘version’: a.b.c and ‘hw_version’: hardware version (Integer).
Return type:dict
get_thermostat_configuration(id, fields=None)¶

Get a specific thermostat_configuration defined by its id. :param id: The id of the thermostat_configuration :param fields: The field of the thermostat_configuration to get, None if all

get_thermostat_configurations(fields=None)¶

Get all thermostat_configurations. :param fields: The field of the thermostat_configuration to get, None if all

get_thermostat_status()¶

Get the status of the thermostats.

Returns:global status information about the thermostats: ‘thermostats_on’, ‘automatic’ and ‘setpoint’ and ‘status’: a list with status information for all thermostats, each element in the list is a dict with the following keys: ‘id’, ‘act’, ‘csetp’, ‘output0’, ‘output1’, ‘outside’, ‘mode’.
Return type:dict
get_timezone()¶

Get the timezone for the gateway.

Returns:‘timezone’: the timezone in ‘Continent/City’ format (String).
Return type:dict
get_total_energy()¶

Get the total energy (Wh) consumed by the power modules.

Returns:modules id as key: [day, night].
Return type:dict
get_update_output()¶

Get the output of the last update.

Returns:‘output’: String with the output from the update script.
Return type:dict
get_usernames()¶

Get the names of the users on the gateway. Only possible in authorized mode.

Returns:‘usernames’: list of usernames (String).
Return type:dict
get_version()¶

Get the version of the openmotics software.

Returns:‘version’: String (a.b.c).
Return type:dict
health_check()¶

Requests the state of the various services and checks the returned value for the global state

in_power_address_mode()¶

Check if the power modules are in address mode.

Returns:‘address_mode’: Boolean
Return type:dict
index()¶

Index page of the web service (Gateway GUI) :returns: Contents of index.html :rtype: str

indicate()¶

Blinks the Status led on the Gateway to indicate the module

install_plugin(md5, package_data)¶

Install a new plugin. The package_data should include a __init__.py file and will be installed in /opt/openmotics/python/plugins/<name>.

Parameters:
  • md5 (String) – md5 sum of the package_data.
  • package_data (multipart/form-data encoded byte string.) – a tgz file containing the content of the plugin package.
login(username, password, accept_terms=None, timeout=None)¶

Login to the web service, returns a token if successful, returns HTTP status code 401 otherwise.

Parameters:
  • username (str) – Name of the user.
  • password (str) – Password of the user.
  • accept_terms (bool | None) – True if the terms are accepted
  • timeout (int) – Optional session timeout. 30d >= x >= 1h
Returns:

Authentication token
Return type:

str
logout(token)¶

Logout from the web service.

Returns:‘status’: ‘OK’
Return type:str
master_clear_error_list()¶

Clear the number of errors.

master_restore(data)¶

Restore a backup of the eeprom of the master.

Parameters:data (multipart/form-data encoded bytes (size = 64 kb)) – The eeprom backup to restore.
Returns:‘output’: array with the addresses that were written.
Return type:dict
module_discover_start()¶

Start the module discover mode on the master.

module_discover_status()¶

Gets the status of the module discover mode on the master.

module_discover_stop()¶

Stop the module discover mode on the master.

open_maintenance()¶

Open maintenance mode, return the port of the maintenance socket.

Returns:‘port’: Port on which the maintenance ssl socket is listening (Integer between 6000 and 7000).
Return type:dict
remove_plugin(name)¶

Remove a plugin. This removes the package data and configuration data of the plugin.

Parameters:name (str) – Name of the plugin to remove.
remove_user(username)¶

Remove a user. Only possible in authorized mode.

Parameters:username (str) – Name of the user to remove.
reset_master()¶

Perform a cold reset on the master.

Returns:‘status’: ‘OK’.
Return type:dict
restore_full_backup(backup_data)¶

Restore a full backup containing the master eeprom and the sqlite databases.

Parameters:backup_data (multipart/form-data encoded bytes.) – The full backup to restore: tar containing 4 files: master.eep, config.db, scheduled.db, power.db and eeprom_extensions.db as a string of bytes.
Returns:dict with ‘output’ key.
Return type:dict
set_airco_status(thermostat_id, airco_on)¶

Set the mode of the airco attached to a given thermostat.

Parameters:
  • thermostat_id (int) – The thermostat id.
  • airco_on (bool) – Turns the airco on if True.
Returns:

dict with ‘status’
Return type:

dict
set_all_lights_floor_off(floor)¶

Turn all lights on a given floor off.

set_all_lights_floor_on(floor)¶

Turn all lights on a given floor on.

set_all_lights_off()¶

Turn all lights off.

set_can_led_configuration(config)¶

Set one can_led_configuration.

Parameters:config (dict) – The can_led_configuration to set: can_led_configuration dict: contains ‘id’ (Id), ‘can_led_1_function’ (Enum), ‘can_led_1_id’ (Byte), ‘can_led_2_function’ (Enum), ‘can_led_2_id’ (Byte), ‘can_led_3_function’ (Enum), ‘can_led_3_id’ (Byte), ‘can_led_4_function’ (Enum), ‘can_led_4_id’ (Byte), ‘room’ (Byte)
set_can_led_configurations(config)¶

Set multiple can_led_configurations.

set_per_thermostat_mode(thermostat_id, automatic, setpoint)¶

Set the thermostat mode of a given thermostat. Thermostats can be set to automatic or manual, in case of manual a setpoint (0 to 5) can be provided.

Parameters:
  • thermostat_id (int) – The thermostat id
  • automatic (bool) – Automatic mode (True) or Manual mode (False).
  • setpoint (int) – The current setpoint.

  • voltage (float) – The voltage to set for the power module.
set_pulse_counter_amount(amount)¶

Set the number of pulse counters. The minimum is 24, these are the pulse counters that can be linked to an input. An amount greater than 24 will result in virtual pulse counter that can be set through the API.

set_pulse_counter_configuration(config)¶

Set one pulse_counter_configuration.

set_pulse_counter_configurations(config)¶

Set multiple pulse_counter_configurations.

set_pulse_counter_status(pulse_counter_id, value)¶

Sets a pulse counter to a value. This can only be done for virtual pulse counters, with a pulse_counter_id >= 24.

set_thermostat_configurations(config)¶

Set multiple thermostat_configurations.

set_thermostat_mode(thermostat_on, automatic=None, setpoint=None, cooling_mode=False, cooling_on=False)¶

Set the global mode of the thermostats. Thermostats can be on or off (thermostat_on), can be in cooling or heating (cooling_mode), cooling can be turned on or off (cooling_on). The automatic and setpoint parameters are here for backwards compatibility and will be applied to all thermostats. To control the automatic and setpoint parameters per thermostat use the v0_set_per_thermostat_mode call instead.

Parameters:
  • thermostat_on (bool) – Whether the thermostats are on
  • automatic (bool or None) – Automatic mode (True) or Manual mode (False). This parameter is here for backwards compatibility, use v0_set_per_thermostat_mode instead.
  • setpoint (int or None) – The current setpoint. This parameter is here for backwards compatibility, use v0_set_per_thermostat_mode instead.
  • cooling_mode (bool or None) – Cooling mode (True) of Heating mode (False)
  • cooling_on – Turns cooling ON when set to true.
  • cooling_on – bool or None
Returns:

‘status’: ‘OK’.
Return type:

dict
set_timezone(timezone)¶

Set the timezone for the gateway.

Parameters:timezone (str) – in format ‘Continent/City’.
set_virtual_sensor(sensor_id, temperature, humidity, brightness)¶

Set the temperature, humidity and brightness value of a virtual sensor.

Parameters:
  • sensor_id (int) – The id of the sensor.
  • temperature (float) – The temperature to set in degrees Celcius
  • humidity (float) – The humidity to set in percentage
  • brightness (int) – The brightness to set in percentage
Returns:

dict with ‘status’.
Return type:

dict

Reports the actual position of a shutter :param id: The id of the shutter. :param position: The actual position :param direction: The direction

update(version, md5, update_data=None)¶

Perform an update.

Parameters:
  • version (str) – the new version number.
  • md5 (str) – the md5 sum of update_data.
  • update_data (multipart/form-data encoded byte string.) – a tgz file containing the update script (update.sh) and data.
